logic

Class Character

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.Character
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Guard, Hero, Ogre

    public abstract class Character
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class is an abstract class that will be the base for every character in game, giving basic movability to the character. It also associates them with a weapon, if that is the case.
    Author:
    Jo√£o Vieira, Susana Lima
    See Also:
    Weapon, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Character

        public Character(int newX,
                 int newY,
                 char newSymbol,
                 boolean hasWeapon)
        Creates a Character in preferred x and y values and given symbol. Case he has a weapon, set hasWeapon to true. showCli is predefined as true.
        Parameters:
        newX - the new value of x
        newY - the new value of y
        newSymbol - the new value of symbol
        hasWeapon - the new value of hasWeapon

        public void setPosition(int newX,

      • setClubAboveKey

        public void setClubAboveKey(boolean val)
        If there is a Weapon that is a Club, set Club aboveKey value to val.
        Parameters:
        val - the new value of Club aboveKey

      • moveUp

        public void moveUp()
        Set this Character position to one unit above the current position. Updates values of prevX and prevY to the current position values. Decreases this Character y by a unit (equivalent to moving up).

      • moveDown

        public void moveDown()
        Set this Character position to one unit under the current position. Updates values of prevX and prevY to the current position values. Increases this Character y by a unit (equivalent to moving down).

      • moveLeft

        public void moveLeft()
        Set this Character position to one unit to the left of the current position. Updates values of prevX and prevY to the current position values. Decreases this Character x by a unit (equivalent to moving left).

      • moveRight

        public void moveRight()
        Set this Character position to one unit to the right of the current position. Updates values of prevX and prevY to the current position values. Increases this Character x by a unit (equivalent to moving right).

      • updatePosition

        public void updatePosition(char command)
        Set this Character x and y values accordingly to the command given. Calls upon this Class move*() functions in order to do that update.
        Parameters:
        command - the char used to update this Character position

      • setToPreviousPosition

        public void setToPreviousPosition()
        Set this Character x and y values to prevX and prevY respectively. Places Character in the previous position.

      • reverseCommand

        public char reverseCommand(char command)
        Given a specific command, it return the calculated command that can move this Character in the opposite direction
        Parameters:
        command - the char to be used as reference to move this Character in the opposite direction
        Returns:
        the calculated opposite command

      • isCaptured

        public boolean isCaptured(Character c)
        Checks if this Character and character c (in the possibility of having a weapon) are in capturing proximity (distance minor or equal to one unit).
        Parameters:
        c - the Character with which the proximity is checked
        Returns:
        true if in capturing proximity of weapon, else false
